oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Simplicissimus : the German adventurer
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Grimmelshausen, Hans Jakob Christoph von, 1625-1676 ; Osborne, John C.,1928-
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Knoxville, Tenn. : Newfound Press, University of Tennessee Libraries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Electronic edition of John C. Osborne's "Simplicissimus, The German Adventurer", an English translation of the German literary work "Der abenteuerliche Simplicissimus" (1669), originally by Hans Jacob Christoffel von Grimmelshausen.

"The German Simplici√üimus, that is: The Description of the Life of a Peculiar Wanderer Named Melchior Sternfels von Fuchshaim, Including Where and in What Manner He Came into This World, What He Saw, Learned, Experienced and Put Up With Therein; Also Why He Voluntarly Left It. Exceedingly Amusing and in Many Ways Useful to Read. Brought to Light by German Schlerfhelm of Sulsfort. Mongelpart, Printed in the Shop of Johann Fillion, in the year 1669." -- PDF t.p.
Contents: Book 1 -- Book 2 -- Book 3 -- Book 4 -- Book 5
